reviews.review_msg: Dr. Northwood is a decent prof and personable - she flies through the slides but will explain the "important" concepts very clearly. She will tell you what is examinable and what is not. If you do the textbook questions and canvas quizzes you'll be good (she takes the questions word for word). The exams were not difficult at all.
Super condescending tone and doesn't care for the course.

Doesn't care one bit about actually teaching. Only memorizing something for the sake of a test is not the same as actually having a good understanding or the material. Other profs are harder but at least their exams are fair for people who put in the effort to understand, not just memorize. If she can't bring herself to care about teaching, RETIRE

Complete disregard of students' learning, seems to just emphasize what students should memorize in lecture rather than LEARN. The lack of effort put into teaching surpasses that of ANY prof I've had at SFU. Would NEVER take again. Taking a class with this prof is a waste of time and money if she can't bring herself to actually teach anything.

Dr. Northwood is always very clear on exactly what will be expected of you on her exams. Immunology is not an easy class, but she made sure that she was clear on what was important, and the level of detail we needed to know. The exams were fair, with extra time allowed, and the marking was very fair. Do the practice questions and you'll do well.

Dr. Northwood is definitely one of my recommended instructors for MBB classes. I have taken her in MBB231 before, and she delivers her lectures well and keeps class entertaining. She emphasizes what things from her slides are gonna be in the exam, so always keep note of that. Great prof! (P.S. She has adorable cats too)

This was my 2nd course with Dr. Northwood and she my fav prof at SFU! Exams are extremely fair if you complete the textbook and extra practice questions. Her lectures are thorough and she will often present new concepts with numerous diagrams to ensure there is no confusion. She will put the hammer down if she needs to though, so don't cross her.
She is by far one of the best profs that I have in my undergrad, as she truly cared about her students and her exams were also quite fair! I would definitely take another class with her !!

Dr. Northwood is such a nice prof. I didn't really like the way she presented her lectures, but I appreciated how she would pause her lecturing to answer questions from students when concepts were not clear. Her exams are very straight forward and fair. I would take another class with her for sure.
